name: Seafood Lasagna with Crab and Shrimp
author: Rayna Jordan
summary: I improved on a friends recipe...now it is the best I ever cooked or tasted!
ingredients: ⅛ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
2 (10.75 ounce) cans  condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 (6 ounce) can crabmeat, drained and flaked
½ cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
directions: Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook pasta for 8 to 10 minutes, or until al dente; drain, and rinse in cold water
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
In a skillet, cook onion in butter over medium heat until tender
Remove from heat, and stir in cream cheese, cottage cheese, egg, basil, and salt and pepper
In a medium bowl, mix together the soup, milk, wine, crabmeat, and shrimp
Lay 3 cooked lasagna noodles on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish
Spread 1/3 of the onion mixture over the noodles
Then spread 1/3 of the soup mixture over the onion layer
Repeat the noodle, onion, soup layers twice more
Top with Cheddar cheese and Parmesan cheese
Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes, or until heated through and bubbly
